tools.name: add_memory
tools.description: AUTOMATICALLY use when user shares important information, code snippets, decisions, learnings, or context that should be remembered for future sessions. Includes smart categorization and auto-linking.

category.description: Memory category (personal, work, code, research, conversations, preferences)

project.description: Project name to organize memory files

related_memories.description: IDs of related memories for cross-referencing

tools.name: get_memory
tools.description: Retrieve a memory by ID

tools.name: list_memories
tools.description: List all stored memories or memories from a specific project

limit.description: Maximum number of memories to return

tools.name: delete_memory
tools.description: Delete a memory by ID

tools.name: search_memories
tools.description: AUTOMATICALLY use when user asks about past work, previous decisions, looking for examples, or needs context from earlier sessions. Provides semantic and keyword-based search.

tools.name: test_tool
tools.description: Simple test tool to verify MCP is working

tools.name: generate_dropoff
tools.description: Generate conversation dropoff document for session handoff with context from recent memories, git status, and project info

session_summary.description: Brief summary of work done in this session

include_recent_memories.description: Include recent memories in the dropoff

include_git_status.description: Include git status and recent commits

recent_memory_count.description: Number of recent memories to include

output_path.description: Custom output directory path. If not provided, auto-detects session-dropoffs/ folder or defaults to current directory

tools.name: create_task
tools.description: Create a new task with intelligent memory linking. Tasks start in "todo" status. IMPORTANT: After creating a task, remember to update its status to "in_progress" when you begin working on it. Proper state management helps track workflow and productivity.

auto_link.description: Automatically find and link relevant memories

tools.name: update_task
tools.description:
Update task status and details. 

STATE MANAGEMENT GUIDELINES:
- Always mark tasks as "in_progress" when starting work on them
- Update to "done" immediately after completing a task
- Set to "blocked" when encountering obstacles or dependencies
- Use "todo" for tasks not yet started

IMPORTANT: Proactively manage task states throughout the work lifecycle. Don't wait for user prompts - update states as work progresses to maintain accurate workflow visibility.

add_subtasks.description: Task titles to add as subtasks

tools.name: list_tasks
tools.description: List tasks with filtering options. Shows task status distribution and workflow health. Use this to monitor work progress and identify tasks that need status updates.

tools.name: get_task_context
tools.description: Get detailed task information including status, relationships, and connected memories. Use this to understand task context and determine if status updates are needed.

depth.description: How many levels of connections to traverse

tools.name: delete_task
tools.description: Delete a task and its subtasks

tools.name: enhance_memory_metadata
tools.description: Generate optimized title and summary for a memory to improve dashboard card display. Uses intelligent content analysis to create concise, meaningful titles (max 60 chars) and summaries (max 150 chars).

memory_id.description: The ID of the memory to enhance with title and summary

regenerate.description: Force regeneration even if title/summary already exist

tools.name: batch_enhance_memories
tools.description: Batch process multiple memories to add optimized titles and summaries. Useful for enhancing existing memories that lack proper metadata for dashboard display.

limit.description: Maximum number of memories to process (default: 50)

skip_existing.description: Skip memories that already have titles/summaries (default: true)

tools.name: smart_status_update
tools.description: AUTOMATICALLY use when user mentions status changes in natural language. Intelligently parses natural language to determine intended status changes with validation and automation.

task_id.description: Task ID to update (optional - can be inferred from natural language)

natural_language_input.description: Natural language description of the status change (e.g., "I finished the auth module", "the API work is blocked")

apply_automation.description: Whether to apply automation suggestions (default: true)

tools.name: get_task_status_analytics
tools.description: AUTOMATICALLY use when user asks about task progress, status overview, productivity metrics, or wants analytics. Provides comprehensive status insights and recommendations.

tools.name: validate_task_workflow
tools.description: Validate a proposed task status change with intelligent suggestions and workflow analysis. Use when you need to check if a status change makes sense.

tools.name: get_automation_suggestions
tools.description: Get intelligent automation suggestions for a task based on context analysis. Use when you want to see what automated actions are possible.

task_id.description: Task ID to analyze for automation opportunities

tools.name: batch_enhance_memories_ollama
tools.description: Batch process memories using local AI (Ollama) for privacy-focused title/summary generation. Processes large numbers of memories efficiently without external API calls.

limit.description: Maximum number of memories to process (default: 50)

skip_existing.description: Skip memories that already have titles/summaries (default: true)

batch_size.description: Number of memories to process in parallel (default: 5)

tools.name: batch_enhance_tasks_ollama
tools.description: Batch process tasks using local AI (Ollama) for privacy-focused title/description enhancement. Processes large numbers of tasks efficiently without external API calls.

limit.description: Maximum number of tasks to process (default: 50)

skip_existing.description: Skip tasks that already have enhanced titles/descriptions (default: true)

batch_size.description: Number of tasks to process in parallel (default: 5)

tools.name: check_ollama_status
tools.description: Check if Ollama server is running and list available models for local AI processing.

show_models.description: Whether to list available models (default: true)

tools.name: enhance_memory_ollama
tools.description: Enhance a single memory with local AI (Ollama) for privacy-focused title/summary generation.

memory_id.description: ID of the memory to enhance

force_update.description: Force update even if memory already has title/summary (default: false)

tools.name: deduplicate_memories
tools.description: Find and remove duplicate memory files, keeping the newest version of each memory ID. Use this to clean up duplicate memories caused by batch operations.

preview_only.description: Preview what would be removed without actually deleting files (default: false)
